div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

a.title: The Governor's School of Southside Virginia
a.span: The Governor's School of Southside Virginia

li.a: The Governor's School of Southside Virginia

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif; color: black;
font-size: 18pt; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif; color: black;

strong.span: of “VA TV Classroom” by Va. Public TV Stations

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: RICHMOND — Superintendent of Public Instruction James Lane announced today that four Virginia public media stations will broadcast teacher-led classroom instruction aligned with the commonwealth’s academic standards into homes across the state beginning Monday, April 13.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: Blue Ridge PBS, VPM, WETA and WHRO Public Media worked closely with the Virginia Department of Education to create “VA TV Classroom” to provide instruction to students in grades K-10 who are unable to access other distance learning options due to a lack of high-speed internet.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “VA TV Classroom” will air instructional content from 1-3 p.m., Monday through Friday.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “I would like to thank Blue Ridge PBS, VPM, WETA and WHRO Public Media for providing this resource for students while schools are closed as part of the commonwealth’s strategy to slow the spread of the coronavirus and protect public health,” Lane said. “It is nothing short of amazing that these public media stations were able to create ‘VA TV Classroom’ and schedule its launch within a month of the governor’s initial order to close schools.”

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: The “VA TV Classroom” on-air schedule is as follows:

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

li.span: K-3 instruction airs from 1-2 p.m. with Standards of Learning-aligned content provided by WHRO Public Media. “Learn to Grow with WHRO” segments will be 15 minutes in length and led by teachers.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

li.span: Grades 7-10 instruction airs from 2-3 p.m. with SOL-aligned content provided by WHRO Public Media focusing on Earth Science and Algebra 1.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

li.span: During the week of April 27, “VA TV Classroom” will add a special hour from 3-4 p.m. called “AP Prep Week,” with content provided by Virtual Virginia — in collaboration with WHRO — focusing on a different AP subject each day. The hour will include two 30-minute segments.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “WHRO is proud to be a part of ‘VA TV Classroom.’ WHRO actually stands for Home Room One,” WHRO President and CEO Bert Schmidt said. “WHRO was created nearly 60 years ago as a way to bring the classroom into homes via the TV. Much of our educational instruction is now created digitally, but knowing so many students now don’t have access to our online resources, we were thrilled to bring this important instruction back to our air.”

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “At a time when all of Virginia’s students are out of school, public media is a valuable, trusted resource our communities can rely on to deliver high-quality educational content for all ages. VPM is honored to partner with Virginia’s public television stations and the state Department of Education to give students and their families a way to continue their learning at home,” said Jayme Swain, President of VPM and CEO of the Virginia Foundation for Public Media.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “WETA is proud to serve Virginia communities with accessible educational programming and resources that meet the academic needs of students,” said Sharon Percy Rockefeller, President and CEO of WETA. “Public media has a vital role to play during this unprecedented time, and we have much to offer educators, parents and caregivers as they seek trusted, enriching content for young learners.”

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “Blue Ridge PBS is committed to our community and helping our children and families during this unprecedented time,” said Will Anderson, President and CEO of Blue Ridge PBS. “We will continue to use our broadcast and online resources to provide meaningful educational content to Southwest Virginia.”

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “VA TV Classroom” can be seen throughout the commonwealth on the following channels:

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

p.span: WHRO – WHRO World: via antenna 15.2, Cox 107 and Verizon FiOS 460

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

p.span: WETA – WETA PBS Kids: via antenna 26.3, Comcast 266, Cox 801, Verizon FiOS 472 and RCN 38

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

p.span: Blue Ridge PBS – SWVAPTV: via antenna 15.2, streaming services Blue Ridge Streaming and Project Southwest on YouTube, Citizens Cable 82, Cox 107, Comcast/Xfinity 264 and Lumos 17 (Shentel, Bedford, Covington, Glade Hill, Radford, Rocky Mount, Rustburg and Wytheville: 157)

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: “I believe that ‘VA TV Classroom’ will make a tremendous difference this spring as schools endeavor to provide continuity of learning for students, especially in communities where online learning is a challenge,” Lane said. “This programming builds on the long-standing partnership between VDOE and public television to support teaching and learning across the state.”

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);
font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);
font-size: 18pt; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);

p.span: Owned by 21 Eastern Virginia school divisions, WHRO Public Media also delivers online educational and new media services to 286,000 students and 25,000 educators per month. WHRO’s digital course offerings and resources including eMediaVA are available free to all: https://digitallearning.whro.org/.

div.div: Post Office Box 790, Charlotte Court House, VA 23923

div.span: This website is in the process of being updated to ensure accessibility and compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. During this process, any website accessibility concerns may be brought to the attention of the Webmaster via email webmaster@ccps.k12.va.us or phone: (434) 542-5151.

div.p: You are now leaving the CCPS site.
